Package org.ejbca.samples

Class RemoteVerifyServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • org.ejbca.samples.RemoteVerifyServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    public class RemoteVerifyServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    Servlet to authenticate a user. Simple database using a file to keep users in format: instance;username;password;DN DN is in form: dn-c:dn-o:dn-ou:dn-ln:dn-gn:dn-cn where parts can be left out as desired. Expects these parameters when called: (error 500 if any missing)
    • user=<username>
    • password=<password>
    • version=<major>.<minor>

    Returns a logic token stating that user is authenticated followed by the information to use for this user's certificate.

    Version:
    $Id: RemoteVerifyServlet.java 19901 2014-09-30 14:29:38Z anatom $
    Author:
    Original code by Peter Neemeth
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • authenticateUser

        protected AuthResult authenticateUser​(String username,
                                      String password)
        Authenticate a user given a querystring. This is the only method a customer should have to rewrite/override.
        Parameters:
        username - containing parsed username from requestor
        password - containing parsed password from requestor
        Returns:
        status + certificate contents in an AuthResult

      • doPost

        protected void doPost​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res)
               throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                      IOException
        Accepts requests and dispatches to authenticateUser in this object.

        Returns one of the following cases. (Apart from status being the first line, order is not specified.)

        • A granted reply: 
             status=200 OK
   result=grant
   dn-ou=OU
   dn-o=O
   dn-cn=CN
   end
        • A rejected reply: 
             status=200 OK
   result=reject
   message=Wrong username/password.
   end
        • A failed request: 
             status=400
   message=Server can't handle given protocol version
   end
        Overrides:
        doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Parameters:
        req - DOCUMENT ME!
        res - DOCUMENT ME!
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - when servlet mechanism fails
        IOException - when something fails with basic I/O, such as reading/writing to client.

      • findUserData

        protected String[] findUserData​(String username)
        Gets information for a user.
        Parameters:
        username - user to lookup.
        Returns:
        null (if no user found) or String[] with [0] as passwd and [1] as certificate contents.

      • loadUserDB

        protected void loadUserDB()
        Load user DB at servlet load time, ie first access to servlet. It's ok to call this method multiple times, since it simply clears the old cached data each time it's called.

      • addUserData

                           String[] userData)
        Adds information for a user in an instance to users.
